show.description: Retrieve targeting criteria for this deal. This is a deprecated endpoint which will *not* for private usage and will not work for most/any clients.

targetingCriteria.description: The targeting criteria for this deal

featureConstraints.description: A division constraint related to this deal

divisionId.description: The division id for this constraint

startAt.description: The starting time for this constraint. This may not overlap with another startAt for the same division id.

endAt.description: The ending time for this constraint. This may not overlap with another startAt for the same division id.

doNotIndex.description: If this constraint should not be indexed (defaults to false)

prefeatureConstraints.description: The constraints for the deal's prefeature period

divisionId.description: The division id for this constraint

startAt.description: The starting time for this constraint. This may not overlap with another startAt for the same division id.

endAt.description: The ending time for this constraint. This may not overlap with another startAt for the same division id.

distributionRegionCodes.description: A comma separated list of ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 region codes (http://www.iso.org/iso/country_codes/iso_3166_code_lists/country_names_and_code_elements.htm)

scheduled.description: Fetch all deal ids for currently scheduled deals belonging to a given distribution region code within a time range. Note that the time range defines the period in which deals must be non-draft in order to get included in the results. This could be for any of the deal's distribution windows so long as the deal is active in that window.

distributionRegionCodes.description: A comma separated list of ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 region codes (http://www.iso.org/iso/country_codes/iso_3166_code_lists/country_names_and_code_elements.htm)

availableAt.description: An inclusive timestamp which indicates the beginning of the time range.

availableUntil.description: An exclusive timestamp which indicates the end of the time range.

search.description: Specify all deals that satisfy the given criteria within the provided time range

distributionRegionCodes.description: A comma separated list of ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 region codes (http://www.iso.org/iso/country_codes/iso_3166_code_lists/country_names_and_code_elements.htm)

distributionTimeRangeAt.description: An *inclusive* iso8601 timestamp which indicates the start of the distribution time range. This will select deals which have distribution times which overlap with this range.

distributionTimeRangeUntil.description: An *exclusive* iso8601 timestamp which indicates the end of the distribution time range. This will select deals which have distribution times which overlap with this range.

dealImageIds.description: A comma delimited set of deal image keys

categoryIds.description: A comma delimited set of category uuids

status.description: The status of the deals to be selected.

name: deal_catalog
title: Deal catalog
description: Local Merchandising serves up the merchandising content for Groupon's core deals. Merchandising generally covers the content and configuration we produce for presenting deals to consumers. A simple example is editorial writeup. A complex one is deal email scheduling.

clientId.description: The api key that identifies your client.

webDocumentation.intro:
Merchandising

We use the term merchandising to encompass the part of a deal used to control its presentation to the consumer. Some examples include the editorial (writeup, images, traits) and what days it's running in email.

Merchandising is to a fancy box, as Inventory is to what's in that box.

Deals

Deals represent the root of the merchandising system. A Deal groups together a collection of Products, each representing something we are selling to a consumer.

Products

Merchandising Products contain the descriptive content on the actual things we sell at Groupon. Some people also may refer to these as options on a deal.

An example would be the $5 for $10 option on a motel bar deal.
